page.title: 02THE CHURCH OF THE HOLY CROSS
page.content: Although the Domesday Book tells of a Saxon church nothing of it can be identified for certain.The {Norman } period is represented by a central row of pillars, that original small church being expanded by the north aisle, transept and tower in the {English style.The{Perpendicular}period is represented in the south chapel and transept.The upper part of the {tower was rebuilt in the early 18th century to Thomas Sumsion's design. The {nave}holds an early 13th century font, 7 heavily carved{Norman}pillars and a Perpendicular west window.The North transept holds a 13th century { {tomb}possibly of a vicar.There are several monuments of the 17th and 18th centuries. The five{bells}were rehung in 1979 and a treble added.
